Deputy: Respondent, supported the decision of the trial Court to reject the evidence
of Sriyalatha  on the basis of unreliability and contended that the appellants
have not challenged the identification parade and  therefore the identity of
the  three appellants were established beyond reasonable doubt. However,
no authority was relied  upon by  the learned  Deputy Solicitor General
support of his submissions that it was open for the trial Court to select the

Learned: evidence of one witness from  the evidence of the prosecution and reject it

Deputy: in the way as highlighted by the appellants in the appeal before this Court.
